definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: During the talent portion, my voice broke when I went to go for a high note.
sentences.chinese: 在才艺表演部分，我在唱高音段时走音了。

sentences.english: You're out of tune. Let's try it again.
sentences.chinese: 你走音了，我们再试一次吧。

sentences.english: His friends tell him that he sings off key but he doesn't care.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友告诉他说他唱歌走音，但他并不在乎。

sentences.english: He was not even nervous all speak the go tone sandhi.
sentences.chinese: 他紧张得连说话都走音变调了。

definition: to be off-key or out of tune (while singing) (colloquial)
tone deaf/unable to sing in tune
falsetto, same as 假聲|假声
voicing (adjustment of timbre, loudness etc of organ or other musical instrument)
to sing opera music (without staging or make up)
falsetto/opposite: natural or true voice 真聲|真声[zhen1 sheng1]
natural voice/modal voice/true voice/opposite: falsetto 假聲|假声[jia3 sheng1]
